Structs/AKWorldConfiguration.html#/s:10A.name: usesLocation
Structs/AKWorldConfiguration.html#/s:10A.abstract: When true, AKWorld manager is able to translate postions to real work latitude and longitude. Defaults to true

Structs/AKWorldConfiguration.html#/s:10A.name: renderDistance
Structs/AKWorldConfiguration.html#/s:10A.abstract: Sets the maximum distance (in meters) that will be rendred. Defaults to 500

Structs/AKWorldConfiguration.html.name: AKWorldConfiguration
Structs/AKWorldConfiguration.html.abstract: A configuration object used to initialize the AR world.

Structs/AKWorldStatus.html.name: AKWorldStatus

Structs/ConstantScaleEffect.html.name: ConstantScaleEffect
Structs/ConstantScaleEffect.html.abstract: Effect that applies a one-time scale factor.

Structs/ConstantAlphaEffect.html.name: ConstantAlphaEffect
Structs/ConstantAlphaEffect.html.abstract: Effect that applies a one-time alpha value.

Structs/ConstantTintEffect.html.name: ConstantTintEffect
Structs/ConstantTintEffect.html.abstract: Effect that applies a one-time tint color.

Structs/ConstantGlowEffect.html.name: ConstantGlowEffect
Structs/ConstantGlowEffect.html.abstract: Effect that applies a one-time glow value.

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit14AssetError.name: AssetErrorInfo
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit14AssetError.abstract: AssetErrorInfo is used as an Associted Value for a ModelErrorReason and provides the information about the MDLAsset which caused the AKError

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit14ModelError.name: ModelErrorInfo
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit14ModelError.abstract: ModelErrorInfo is used as an Associted Value for a ModelErrorReason and provides the information about the AKGeometricEntity which caused the AKError

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit17PipelineEr.name: PipelineErrorInfo
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit17PipelineEr.abstract: PipelineErrorInfo is used as an Associted Value for a RenderPipelineErrorReason and provides the information about AKError

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit19Underlying.name: UnderlyingErrorInfo
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit19Underlying.abstract: UnderlyingErrorInfo is used as an Associted Value for a AKErrorType and provides the underlying error which caused the AKError

Structs/HeadingRotation.html.name: HeadingRotation
Structs/HeadingRotation.html.abstract: A representation of a 3D rotation. HeadingRotation is backed by a simd_quatf.

Structs/AKSphereLineIntersection.html.name: AKSphereLineIntersection
Structs/AKSphereLineIntersection.html.abstract: An object that represents a line that clipped by the boundaries of a sphere. There are four cases to consider when a line is clipped by a sphere.

Structs/AKWorldDistance.html.name: AKWorldDistance
Structs/AKWorldDistance.html.abstract: Represents the distance in meters between two points in the AR world.

Structs/WorldLocation.html.name: WorldLocation
Structs/WorldLocation.html.abstract: A standard implementaion of AKWorldLocation that provides common initializers that make it easy to derive latitude, longitude, and elevation relative to a reference locatio

Structs/GroundFixedWorldLocation.html.name: GroundFixedWorldLocation
Structs/GroundFixedWorldLocation.html.abstract: An implementation of AKWorldLocation that sets the y (vertical) position of an existing locaiton equal to the estimated ground of the world. This is useful when placing objects in the AR world that rest on the ground.

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit11EulerAngle.name: EulerAngles
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit11EulerAngle.abstract: A structure representing euler angles (roll, yaw, pitch)

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit11MeshGPUDat.name: MeshGPUData
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit11MeshGPUDat.abstract: Data for an object containing one or more meshes.

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit8SkinDataV.name: SkinData
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit8SkinDataV.abstract: Data that describes how a mesh is bound to a skeleton.

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit16AnimatedSk.name: AnimatedSkeleton
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit16AnimatedSk.abstract: Data that stores skeleton data as well as its time-sampled animation.

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit15Environmen.name: EnvironmentData
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit15Environmen.abstract: Data that stores any parameters related to the environment that may affect the rendered objects.

Structs/RenderStats.html.name: RenderStats
Structs/RenderStats.html.abstract: An object that contains the current statistics about the render session

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit16CameraProp.name: CameraProperties
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit16CameraProp.abstract: An object that stores information about the curent state of the camera

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit21Environmen.name: EnvironmentProperties
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit21Environmen.abstract: An object that stores information about the environment

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit16ShadowProp.name: ShadowProperties
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit16ShadowProp.abstract: An object that stores information about the environment

Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit24ArgumentBu.name: ArgumentBufferProperties
Structs.html#/s:10AugmentKit24ArgumentBu.abstract: An object that stores information about the environment

Structs/Entry.html.name: Entry
Structs/Entry.html.abstract: A value that represents a file, a direcotry or a symbolic link within a ZIP Archive.

Protocols/RenderDestinationProvider.html.name: framebufferOnly
Protocols/RenderDestinationProvider.html.abstract: A Boolean value that determines whether the drawable can be used for texture sampling or read/write operations.

Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.name: localStoreManager
Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: A LocalStoreManager that is used to store user location state locally

Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.name: mostReliableARLocation
Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: Provides the CLLocation with the highest accuracy. This gets updated With the most recent location if the most recent location has at least as much accuracy as the last reading.

Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.name: mostReliableARHeading
Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: Provides the CLHeading with the highest accuracy. This gets updated with the most recent location if the most recent location has at least as much accuracy as the last reading.

Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.name: requestAlwaysAuthorization()
Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: Request Always On authoirization with the system

Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.name: requestInUseAuthorization()
Protocols/LocationManager.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: Request When In Use authoirization with the system

Protocols/LocalStoreManager.html#/s:10Au.name: lastKnownLocationData
Protocols/LocalStoreManager.html#/s:10Au.abstract: The users last known location as a serialized Data object

Protocols/LocalStoreManager.html#/s:10Au.name: setLastKnownLocationData(_:)
Protocols/LocalStoreManager.html#/s:10Au.abstract: Set the users last known location as a serialized Data object

Protocols/AKTracker.html#/s:10AugmentKit.name: identifier
Protocols/AKTracker.html#/s:10AugmentKit.abstract: A unique, per-instance identifier. Redefine the `identifier property to require a setter.

Protocols/AKTracker.html#/s:10AugmentKit.name: position
Protocols/AKTracker.html#/s:10AugmentKit.abstract: The position of the tracker. The position is relative to the objects this tracks.

Protocols/AKTarget.html#/s:10AugmentKit8.name: identifier
Protocols/AKTarget.html#/s:10AugmentKit8.abstract: A unique, per-instance identifier. Redefine the `identifier property to require a setter.

Protocols/AKTarget.html#/s:10AugmentKit8.name: vectorDirection
Protocols/AKTarget.html#/s:10AugmentKit8.abstract: A direction vector relative to it’s position and can be a unit vector

Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html#/s:10Augm.name: latitude
Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: A latitude in the the real world

Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html#/s:10Augm.name: longitude
Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: A longitude in the the real world

Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html#/s:10Augm.name: elevation
Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: An elevation in the the real world

Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html#/s:10Augm.name: transform
Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html#/s:10Augm.abstract: A transform, in the coodinate space of the AR eorld, which corresponds to the latitude, longitude, and elevation

Protocols/AKHeading.html#/s:10AugmentKit.name: type
Protocols/AKHeading.html#/s:10AugmentKit.abstract: Determines how the AugmentKit render engine will interperet the value found in offsetRotation. When the HeadingType is set to .absolute, the AugmentKit render engine uses the value of offsetRotation to rotate the object to this orientation. When the HeadingType is set to .relative, the AugmentKit render engine combines the value of offsetRotation with the parent objects rotation to rotate the object to it’s final orientation.

Protocols/AKHeading.html#/s:10AugmentKit.name: offsetRotation
Protocols/AKHeading.html#/s:10AugmentKit.abstract: The value used to calculate the objects final rotation.

Protocols/AKHeading.html#/s:10AugmentKit.name: updateHeading(withPosition:)
Protocols/AKHeading.html#/s:10AugmentKit.abstract: AugmentKit calls this method once per frame to give the object an opportunity to update the offsetRotation before the final rotation calculations are made.

Protocols/AKGeometricEntityGroup.html#/s.name: effects
Protocols/AKGeometricEntityGroup.html#/s.abstract: An array of AKEffect objects that are applied to each AKGeometricEntity in the group by the renderer. If the individual AKGeometricEntity has it’s own effects, they will override the effects here.

Protocols/AKGeometricEntity.html#/s:10Au.name: effects
Protocols/AKGeometricEntity.html#/s:10Au.abstract: An array of AKEffect objects that are applied by the renderer

Protocols/AKGeometricEntity.html#/s:10Au.name: shaderPreference
Protocols/AKGeometricEntity.html#/s:10Au.abstract: Specifies a perfered renderer to use when rendering this enitity. Most will use the standard PBR renderer but some entities may prefer a simpiler renderer when they are not trying to achieve the look of real-world objects.

Protocols/AKGeometricEntity.html#/s:10Au.name: generatesShadows
Protocols/AKGeometricEntity.html#/s:10Au.abstract: Indicates whether this geometry participates in the generation of augmented shadows. As a general guide, geometries that represent real world objects should not generate shadows because they have them already. Augmented geometries, however, should have this property enabled.

Protocols/AKPulsingAnimatable.html#/s:10.name: periodOffset
Protocols/AKPulsingAnimatable.html#/s:10.abstract: The offset to apply to the animation.

Protocols/AKRealSurfaceAnchor.html#/s:10.name: orientation
Protocols/AKRealSurfaceAnchor.html#/s:10.abstract: The orientation of the surface. Either horizontal or vertical

Protocols/AKRealAnchor.html#/s:10Augment.name: arAnchor
Protocols/AKRealAnchor.html#/s:10Augment.abstract: An ARAnchor that will be tracked in the AR world by ARKit

Protocols/AKPathSegmentAnchor.html#/s:10.name: effects
Protocols/AKPathSegmentAnchor.html#/s:10.abstract: An array of AKEffect objects that are applied by the renderer. Overrides the definition in AKGeometricEntity to require a setter

Protocols/AKPathSegmentAnchor.html#/s:10.name: segmentTransform
Protocols/AKPathSegmentAnchor.html#/s:10.abstract: A transform, in the coodinate space of the AR world, which is used to transform the path segment geometry such that it connects with the previous segment to form a line. While worldLocation.transform represents a location (no scaling or roataional component) of the terminating point of the segment, segmentTransform represents a location midpoint between the terminating point for this segment and the terminating point for the previous segment. It also includes a rotatinal and scale component that rotates the segment so that it starts at the previous anchos termination point and ends at this anchors termination point. If there is only one AKPathSegmentAnchor in an AKPath, this property is undefined.

Protocols/AKPathSegmentAnchor.html#/s:10.name: updateSegmentTransform(withLine:)
Protocols/AKPathSegmentAnchor.html#/s:10.abstract: This methods recalculates the position, scale, and rotation of a path segment anchor so that it connects the two points in the line. For the AKLine object, point0 represents the position of the previous AKPathSegmentAnchor and point1 represents the position of this anchor.

Protocols/AKPath.html#/s:10AugmentKit6AK.name: identifier
Protocols/AKPath.html#/s:10AugmentKit6AK.abstract: A unique, per-instance identifier. Redefine the `identifier property to require a setter.

Protocols/AKPath.html#/s:10AugmentKit6AK.name: updateSegmentTransforms(withRenderSphere:)
Protocols/AKPath.html#/s:10AugmentKit6AK.abstract: This methods calculates the position, scale, and rotation of each path segment anchor so that it connects to the next and previous anchors.

Protocols/AKPath.html#/s:10AugmentKit6AK.name: segmentPoints
Protocols/AKPath.html#/s:10AugmentKit6AK.abstract: An array of AKPathSegmentAnchor that represent the starting and ending points for the line segments. A path must have at least two AKPathSegmentAnchor in the segmentPoints array. All segments in a path are connected such that the ending point of one segment is the starting point for the next. Therefor an array of three AKPathSegmentAnchor instances represents a path with two line segments

Protocols/AKAugmentedAnchor.html#/s:10Au.name: arAnchor
Protocols/AKAugmentedAnchor.html#/s:10Au.abstract: An ARAnchor that will be tracked in the AR world by ARKit

Protocols/AKAnchor.html#/s:10AugmentKit8.name: identifier
Protocols/AKAnchor.html#/s:10AugmentKit8.abstract: A unique, per-instance identifier. Redefine the `identifier property to require a setter.

Protocols/AKWorldMonitor.html#/s:10Augme.name: update(renderStats:)
Protocols/AKWorldMonitor.html#/s:10Augme.abstract: Called when the world’s render statistics changes

Protocols/ModelProvider.html#/s:10Augmen.name: registerAsset(_:forObjectType:identifier:)
Protocols/ModelProvider.html#/s:10Augmen.abstract: Implementations should store the MDLAsset and associate it with the provided type and identifier such that when loadAsset(forObjectType:,identifier:,completion:) is called, the appropriate MDLAsset can re returned.

Protocols/ModelProvider.html#/s:10Augmen.name: unregisterAsset(forObjectType:identifier:)
Protocols/ModelProvider.html#/s:10Augmen.abstract: Implementations should remove any stored MDLAssets associated with the provided type and identifier

Protocols/ModelProvider.html#/s:10Augmen.name: loadAsset(forObjectType:identifier:completion:)
Protocols/ModelProvider.html#/s:10Augmen.abstract: When called, the ModelProvider implementation should load and return the MDLAsset most appropriate given the type and identifier. ModelProvider should always try to provide the a MDLAsset when one is requested if at all possible. If a MDLAsset for a specific identifier is not found, the ModelProvider should provide an MDLAsset matching the type, or a default MDLAsset.

Protocols/ModelProvider.html.name: ModelProvider
Protocols/ModelProvider.html.abstract: Defines an object that is responsible for loading MDLAsset asset models. The AugmentKit render engine loads models as they are needed in the AR world. A ModelProvider implementation is responsible for loading MDLAsset‘s when requested and caching them as needed.

Protocols/AKWorldMonitor.html.name: AKWorldMonitor
Protocols/AKWorldMonitor.html.abstract: An object that adheres to the AKWorldMonitor protocol can receive updates when the world state changes.

Protocols/AKAnchor.html.name: AKAnchor
Protocols/AKAnchor.html.abstract: An AKAnchor represents an object that can be rendered into the AKWorld at an anchored (fixed) position. The AKAnchor protocol has two sub protocols, AKAugmentedAnchor and AKRealAnchor that represent augmented objects (objects that don’t exist in the real world) and real objects, objects that exist both in the augmented work and the real world.

Protocols/AKAugmentedAnchor.html.name: AKAugmentedAnchor
Protocols/AKAugmentedAnchor.html.abstract: Represents an anchor placed in the AR world. This anchor only exists in the AR world as opposed to a real anchor like a detected horizontal / vertical plane which exists in the physical world.

Protocols/AKPathSegmentAnchor.html.name: AKPathSegmentAnchor
Protocols/AKPathSegmentAnchor.html.abstract: An AR anchor that represents a beginning or end of a path segment. Two or more of these can be used to create a path in the AR world. These anchors have an empty model so they cannot be rendered by themselves, They must be used on conjunction with an AKPath object.

Protocols/AKRealAnchor.html.name: AKRealAnchor
Protocols/AKRealAnchor.html.abstract: Represents an anchor in the AR world that is tied to an object in the real world for example a detected horizontal / vertical plane wich represents a table or wall

Protocols/AKRealSurfaceAnchor.html.name: AKRealSurfaceAnchor
Protocols/AKRealSurfaceAnchor.html.abstract: And anchor representing a surface plane that has been detected in the real world. Usually these are provided by the AR engine, not created by hand.

Protocols/AKAnimatable.html.name: AKAnimatable
Protocols/AKAnimatable.html.abstract: Describes a animatable value. That is, a value that changes over time.

Protocols/AKPulsingAnimatable.html.name: AKPulsingAnimatable
Protocols/AKPulsingAnimatable.html.abstract: Describes an AKAnimatable that oscillates between a minValue and maxValue over a time period

Protocols/AKEffect.html.name: AKEffect
Protocols/AKEffect.html.abstract: Describes an effect that can be applied to a model. AKEffects are evalueated and applied by the shader and apply to the model as a whole. AKEffects are animatable

Protocols/AKEntity.html.name: AKEntity
Protocols/AKEntity.html.abstract: An AKEntity defines an object that can be used and tracked by AugmentKit. Each instance of an AKEntity is uniquely represented by it’s identifier and can be classified by type.

Protocols/AKGeometricEntity.html.name: AKGeometricEntity
Protocols/AKGeometricEntity.html.abstract: An AKGeometricEntity represents a 3D geomentry existing in world space. It may be a rendered augmented object like a virtual sign or piece of furniture, or it may be a non-rendered reference geomentry that is used as meta information about the AR world like a 2D plane might represent a table top or a wall. The object’s geometry is defiened by the model property and may contain animation therefore the geomentry it does not always have to represent a rigid body. AKGeometricEntity does not contain any position information so it does not mean anything by itself in the context of the AKWorld. It does serve as a base protocol for more meaningful Types like AKAnchor and AKTracker.

Protocols/AKHeading.html.name: AKHeading
Protocols/AKHeading.html.abstract: An AKHeading represents a angular rotation in 3d space. The rotation can be absolute (a rotation relative to the global x,y,z axis), or relative (a rotation relative to a local x, y, z axis). When the HeadingType is set to .absolute, the AugmentKit render engine uses the value of offsetRotation to rotate the object to this orientation. When the HeadingType is set to .relative, the AugmentKit render engine combines the value of offsetRotation with the parent objects rotation to rotate the object to it’s final orientation.

Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html.name: AKWorldLocation
Protocols/AKWorldLocation.html.abstract: AKWorldLocation is a protocol that ties together a position in the AR world with a locaiton in the real world. When the ARKit session starts up, it crates an arbitrary coordinate system where the origin is where the device was located at the time of initialization. Every device and every AR session, therefore, has it’s own local coordinate system. In order to reason about how the coordinate system relates to actual locations in the real world, AugmentKit uses location services to map a point in the ARKit coordinate system to a latitude and longitude in the real world and stores this as a AKWorldLocation instance. Once a reliable AKWorldLocation is found, other AKWorldLocation objects can be derived by calculating their relative distance from the one reliable reference AKWorldLocation object.

Protocols/AKTarget.html.name: AKTarget
Protocols/AKTarget.html.abstract: An AKTarget represents an object that can be rendered into the AKWorld. It’s position is determined by a relative position (similar to an AKTracker) and a direction vector. The vector extends from the relative position and where it intersects another object in the AKWorld is where the target is rendered. A good example of this would be an augmented reality laser pointer. The red dot of the laser is where the object is rendered but where that dot is located in the AKWorld depends on where you hold the laser pointer (the position), the direction the laser pointer is pointed (the vector), and what’s in its path (an intersection with another object).

Protocols.html#/s:10AugmentKit18AKAugmen.name: AKAugmentedTracker
Protocols.html#/s:10AugmentKit18AKAugmen.abstract: Represents a tracker placed in the AR world. This tracker only exists in the AR world as opposed to a real tracker like a person or a car which exists in the physical world.

Protocols.html#/s:10AugmentKit13AKRealTr.name: AKRealTracker
Protocols.html#/s:10AugmentKit13AKRealTr.abstract: Represents a tracker in the AR world that is tied to an moving object in the real world. For example a person or a car.

Protocols/AKTracker.html.name: AKTracker
Protocols/AKTracker.html.abstract: An AKTracker represents an object that can be rendered into the AKWorld. It’s position is relative to another object and therefore tracks the other opject and is not fixed. The AKTracker protocol has two sub protocols, AKAugmentedTracker and AKRealTracker that represent augmented objects (objects that don’t exist in the real world) and real objects, objects that exist both in the augmented work and the real world.

Classes/Heading.html#/s:10AugmentKit7Hea.name: type
Classes/Heading.html#/s:10AugmentKit7Hea.abstract: Determines how the AugmentKit render engine will interperet the value found in offsetRotation. When the HeadingType is set to .absolute, the AugmentKit render engine uses the value of offsetRotation to rotate the object to this orientation. When the HeadingType is set to .relative, the AugmentKit render engine combines the value of offsetRotation with the parent objects rotation to rotate the object to it’s final orientation.

Classes/Heading.html#/s:10AugmentKit7Hea.name: offsetRotation
Classes/Heading.html#/s:10AugmentKit7Hea.abstract: The value used to calculate the objects final rotation.

Classes/Heading.html#/s:10AugmentKit7Hea.name: updateHeading(withPosition:)

Classes/Heading.html#/s:10AugmentKit7Hea.name: heading(byCombining:)
Classes/Heading.html#/s:10AugmentKit7Hea.abstract: Adds all offsets and returns a new heading. If all of the headings are relative, the new heading will be relative. If one of the headings is absolute, than the new heading will be absolute. If there is more than one absolute heading, this function will throw an error.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: The MTKView to which the AR world will be rendered.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: currentWorldLocation
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: The current AKWorldLocation of the user (technically the user’s device). The transform is relative to the ARKit origin which was the position of the camera when the AR session starts. This world location contains no rotation information, the heading is always aligned to the referenceWorldLocation. When usesLocation = true, the axis are rotated such that z points due south.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: currentWorldLocationWithRotation
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: Same as currentWorldLocation with the rotation component of the device multiplied in

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: referenceWorldLocation
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: A location that represents a reliable AKWorldLocation object tying together a real world location (latitude, longitude, and elevation) to AR world transforms. This location has a transform that is relative to origin of the AR world which was the position of the camera when the AR session starts. When usesLocation = true, the axis of the transform are rotated such that z points due south. This transform correlates to the latitude, longitude, and elevation. This reference location is the basis for calulating transforms based on new lat, lng, elev or translating a new transform to lat, lng, elevation

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: currentGazeLocation
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: The current AKWorldLocation of the user’s gaze, the point where a vector from the center of the device intersects the closes detected surface. The transform is relative to the ARKit origin which was the position of the camera when the AR session starts. When usesLocation = true, the axis are rotated such that z points due south.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: estimatedGroundLayer
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: The lowest horizontal surface anchor which is assumed to be ground. If no horizontal surfaces have been detected, this returns a horizontal surface 3m below the current device position.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: getArchivedWorldMap(completion:)
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: Gets the ARWorldMap and saves it to the temporary directory, returning the URL.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: setWorldMap(worldMap:)
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: Resets the AR Session with the given inital world map.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: loadWorldMap(from:)
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: Load an ARKWorldMap from a file URL.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: worldLocation(withLatitude:longitude:elevation:)
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: Creates a new AKWorldLocation object at the given location in the real world. This method uses the most reliable location provided be CoreLocation and calculates where the provided latitude, longitude, and elevation are relative to the current position. Because of this, the accuracy of the provided AKWorldLocation may be low if this method is called shortly after initializing the AR world.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: worldLocationFromCurrentLocation(withMetersEast:metersUp:metersSouth:)
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: Creates a new AKWorldLocation object at a given x, y, z offset from the current users location.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: worldLocationWithDistanceFromMe(metersToTheRight:metersAbove:metersInFront:)
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: Creates a new AKWorldLocation object which is offset from the current users location. The offsets are given relative to the devices current orientation.

Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.name: headingFacingAtMe(from:)
Classes/AKWorld.html#/s:10AugmentKit7AKW.abstract: Creates a new AKHeading object which faces the current users location from the AKWorldLocation provided. The AKHeading is a fixed heading and does NOT re-orient itself as the user continues to move.

Classes/AKModelProvider.html#/s:10Augmen.name: loadAsset(forObjectType:identifier:completion:)
Classes/AKModelProvider.html#/s:10Augmen.abstract: Provides the MDLAsset matching the identifier. If none is found or if identifier is not specified, it provides the MDLAsset matching the object type.

Classes/AKModelProvider.html.name: AKModelProvider
Classes/AKModelProvider.html.abstract: A standard implementation of ModelProvider. This implementation stores all registered MDLAsset objects in memory and returns them synchronously when loadAsset(forObjectType:,identifier:,completion:) is called.

Classes/AKWorld.html.name: AKWorld
Classes/AKWorld.html.abstract: A single class to hold all world state. It manages it’s own Metal Device, Renderer, and ARSession. Initialize it with a MetalKit View which this class will render into. There should only be one of these per AR View.

Classes/AugmentedAnchor.html.name: AugmentedAnchor
Classes/AugmentedAnchor.html.abstract: A generic AR object that can be placed in the AR world. These can be created and given to the AR engine to render in the AR world.

Classes/AugmentedSurfaceAnchor.html.name: AugmentedSurfaceAnchor
Classes/AugmentedSurfaceAnchor.html.abstract: A generic implementation of AKAugmentedSurfaceAnchor that renders a MDLTexture on a simple plane with a given extent

Classes/AugmentedUIViewSurface.html.name: AugmentedUIViewSurface
Classes/AugmentedUIViewSurface.html.abstract: A AugmentedSurfaceAnchor subclass that is able to display the contents of a UIView as the texture for the surface.

Classes/GuideSurfaceAnchor.html.name: GuideSurfaceAnchor
Classes/GuideSurfaceAnchor.html.abstract: An anchor used for debugging which displays a guide image as the texture for real surfaces detected by ARKit

Classes/PathAnchor.html.name: PathAnchor
Classes/PathAnchor.html.abstract: A generic implementation of AKPath that renders a path using the world locations as endpoints for the path segments.

Classes/PathSegmentAnchor.html.name: PathSegmentAnchor
Classes/PathSegmentAnchor.html.abstract: A generic implementation of a AKPathSegmentAnchor. Instead of creating these objects directly, these objects should be created as part of creating a new AKPath instance.

Classes/RealSurfaceAnchor.html.name: RealSurfaceAnchor
Classes/RealSurfaceAnchor.html.abstract: A generic implementation of AKRealSurfaceAnchor. Renders a featureless plane geometry.

Classes/SameHeading.html.name: SameHeading
Classes/SameHeading.html.abstract: A relative AKHeading that matches the heading of it’s parent. This is the simplest relative heading and is the default heading for Real anchors which (due to the fact that they represent real world geometries) must match the heading of their parent objects.

Classes/NorthHeading.html.name: NorthHeading
Classes/NorthHeading.html.abstract: An absolute AKHeading that is aligned with the AR World’s axis. This is the simplest absolute heading and is the default heading for Augmented anchors.

Classes/AlwaysFacingMeHeading.html.name: AlwaysFacingMeHeading
Classes/AlwaysFacingMeHeading.html.abstract: An absolute AKHeading that rotates to face the users current position.

Classes/WorldHeading.html.name: WorldHeading
Classes/WorldHeading.html.abstract: An absolute AKHeading where the heading can be initialized relative to due north or facing a AKWorldLocation

Classes/AKRelativePosition.html.name: AKRelativePosition
Classes/AKRelativePosition.html.abstract: A data structure that represents a position relative to another reference position in world space.

Classes/AKWorldMap.html.name: AKWorldMap
Classes/AKWorldMap.html.abstract: Wraps ARKit’s ARWorldMap and adds world location properties which ties the World Map to a specific location in the real world. The ARWorldMap provides enough information to tie all of the anchors in arWorldMap to real world locations. The transform, a position in the coordinate space of the arWorldMap is mapped to the latitude, longitude, and elevation. From one knowd reference location, the latitude, longitude, and elevation of every other point in the coordinate space of arWorldMap can be calculated.

Classes/GazeTarget.html.name: GazeTarget
Classes/GazeTarget.html.abstract: An ARTarget object whos vector matches the rotation of the device

Classes/AKLocationUtility.html.name: AKLocationUtility
Classes/AKLocationUtility.html.abstract: A utility for doing location conversion calculations

Classes/QuaternionUtilities.html.name: QuaternionUtilities
Classes/QuaternionUtilities.html.abstract: Tools for using quaternions. Augmentkit uses simd_quatf for all quaternions.

Classes/SHA256.html.name: SHA256
Classes/SHA256.html.abstract: SHA-256 implementation from Secure Hash Algorithm 2 (SHA-2) set of

Classes/DeviceManager.html.name: DeviceManager
Classes/DeviceManager.html.abstract: Provides methods for geting information about the users device

Classes/DefaultLocalStoreManager.html.name: DefaultLocalStoreManager
Classes/DefaultLocalStoreManager.html.abstract: A default implementation of LocalStoreManager which sotores properties in memory

Classes/AKSceneKitUtils.html.name: AKSceneKitUtils
Classes/AKSceneKitUtils.html.abstract: Extensions for loading a model from SceneKit so it can be used as an anchor. This can be excluded if SceneKit is not being used.

Classes/Archive.html.name: Archive
Classes/Archive.html.abstract: A sequence of uncompressed or compressed ZIP entries.

Global Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
